byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Nicholas Casey, James C. McKinley Jr., Emily Palmer, Kate Pastor, Marc Santora and Nate Schweber, and research by Susan C. Beachy and Kitty Bennett.
byline.original: By AL BAKER and J. DAVID GOODMAN

abstract: Tyrone Howard, gunman accused of killing Police Officer Randolph Holder in Upper Manhattan, has long history of arrests and was pursued by police 10 times since shooting rival gang member in September; Howard is thought to be among those involved in bloody rivalries between groups tied to particular housing projects.
lead_paragraph: The police said Tyrone Howard, who is suspected of shooting Officer Randolph Holder on Tuesday night, had been sought after he failed to appear for a court-mandated drug treatment program.

headline.main: Suspect in Fatal Shooting of New York Officer Was on the Run for Weeks, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Officer Faced a Man on the Run

snippet: The police said Tyrone Howard, who is suspected of shooting Officer Randolph Holder on Tuesday night, had been sought after he failed to appear for a court-mandated drug treatment program.
